item.title: First Quarter Consumption Opportunities
item.description: I wanted to make a quick note of some of the best content I have consumed in 2023 so far – especially the new releases. If you trust my judgement, check them out! Film Puss in Boots: The Last Wish is my favourite release of the year so far. All of the elements come together brilliantly: vivid animation, fantastic characters, genuinely funny moments, and a surprisingly mature story that makes it feel like the Logan of the Shrek franchise.

item.title: Student Voice
item.description: After I graduated in 2020, I was asked to provide an article for the Clare Review. I recently found a copy online while looking for something else. For posterity, I reproduce the following from said online version, which also features the excellent Jonty Townson and some nostalgic photos. Dan Wright (2017) UCS President As the outgoing UCS president and a recent graduate, my final year at Clare was one of my best; for obvious reasons, it was also one of the worst.

I want to pay tribute to the National COVID Memorial Wall. Today was its second anniversary, and I visited by chance during a break from the office. Despite walking that stretch of the Thames quite often, the wall never fails to move me. It’s a supremely poignant monument to the devastation that COVID-19 caused, or was allowed to cause, in the UK. The simple act of walking the path provides the time to reflect on those days and the lives we lost (literally and figuratively).
